meanings.definition: A person who is wealthy and upper-class.
meanings.sent1: The toffs in their fancy cars drove past the park.
meanings.sent2: The toffs lived in a grand mansion on the hill.
meanings.sent3: The toffs at the party only talked about expensive vacations.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a toff among commoners in her designer gown.
meanings.sent5: The toffs' extravagant lifestyle was the talk of the town.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are considered to be snobbish or pretentious.
meanings.sent1: The group of toffs at the exclusive club looked down on others.
meanings.sent2: The toffs always turned up their noses at simple pleasures.
meanings.sent3: The toffs' constant bragging about their possessions annoyed everyone.
meanings.sent4: She found herself surrounded by toffs who cared only about appearances.
meanings.sent5: The toffs' elitist attitude made them unpopular among their peers.
